Tools.name: HTML
details: The backbone of web pages, defining structure and content.
Introduces semantic tags(<header>, <article>) for better SEO and accessibility.
Supports multimedia (video/audio tags) without plugins.

Tools.name: CSS
details: Styles and beautifies HTML, enabling animations, and responsive layouts.
Features like Flexbox & Grid simplify complex designs.
Custom properties (variables) for reusable values.

Tools.name: Bootstrap
details: A pre-designed component library for fast, mobile-first development.
Uses a 12-column grid system and ready-made UI elements (buttons, modals).
Themes and customizable via Sass.

Tools.name: Sass
details: CSS preprocessor adding variables, nesting, and mixins for cleaner code.
Compiles to standard CSS, reducing redundancy.
Partials and modular architecture for scalability.

Tools.name: JavaScript
details: The dynamic scripting language of the web.
Handles DOM manipulation, async operations (Promises), and event-driven programming.
Frameworks like React build atop it.

Tools.name: JSON
details: Lightweight data format for APIs and config files.
Human-readable key-value pairs derived from JavaScript objects.
Universal support across languages.

Tools.name: Vite
details: Blazing-fast build tool for modern web apps.
Hot Module Replacement (HMR) for instant updates during development.
Supports React, Vue, and more out of the box.

Tools.name: React
details: A component-based UI library by Facebook.
Uses JSX (HTML-like syntax in JavaScript) and a virtual DOM for performance.
Ecosystem includes hooks, routers, and state managers.

Tools.name: TailwindCSS
details: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid styling without leaving HTML.
No pre-designed components-build custom designs using atomic classes.
PurgeCSS removes unused styles in production.

Tools.name: MySQL
details: Relational database manage system (RDBMS) using SQL.
Stores data in tables with rows/columns, supporting complex queries.
Open-source and widely integrated (e.g., with PHP, Node.js).
